meanings.sent1: The enjoinder of the puzzle pieces created a beautiful picture.
meanings.sent2: The enjoinder of the two rivers formed a larger stream.
meanings.sent3: The enjoinder of flavors in the recipe made it a culinary masterpiece.
meanings.sent4: The enjoinder of voices in the choir filled the hall with harmonious melodies.
meanings.sent5: The enjoinder of colors in the painting brought it to life.

meanings.definition: A legal order or command to do or refrain from doing something
meanings.sent1: The judge issued an enjoinder to stop the construction work immediately.
meanings.sent2: The company received an enjoinder to cease all production until further notice.
meanings.sent3: The enjoinder to wear silly hats on Fridays brought laughter to the office.
meanings.sent4: The strict enjoinder to stay silent during the exam made the room tense.
meanings.sent5: The powerful enjoinder to stand up for what is right resonated with the audience.
